com.seagate.util

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.seagate.util.Config

  • public class Config
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to deal with config files. Each config file is tied to two files:
    1. Read-only default config AKA system config AKA application config that is loaded first and is never overwritten.
    2. Writable config AKA user config that is loaded second and is owerwritten when store() is called.
    The class also implements multi-singleton pattern. There is a default config instance and a map of instances parameterized by default file name and file name. The changes in the config properties can be listened to using PropertyChangeListeners. The class is thread safe, that is can be used by multiple concurrent threads. The class is also safe to be used concurrently from multiple JVMs. The latest issued store() operation will always win.

      • getInstance

        public static Config getInstance(java.lang.String defaultFileName,
                 java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Get config instance identified by the pair of the default file name and file name. If the instance does not exist it will be created.
        Parameters:
        defaultFileName - read-only default AKA system config AKA application config file name.
        fileName - writable AKA user config file name.
        Returns:
        instance
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
